Lady Hawk was startled by the revelation. She tried to remain collected.
"Are we not disrupting this planets growth just by being here?" Lady Hawk
knew the results every time technology was introduced into an ecosystem. "My
hopes aren't to upset the natural balance but to create a middle ground
between what we are and what the planet could be." It was an argument her
father had used hundreds of times but every time the warmongers would turn
the argument around and throw it in his face.

::Feline saw Squizzy and Lady Hawk there. , she quietly walked into a CR
chamber and started to heal.

Whan the door to the CR chamber was closed, Lady Hawk walked over to where
mech fluid had dropped to the floor from Felines wounds, she scraped it up
and placed it in a test tube. It was a soiled sample but it was still one
more sample than she had before.

From: <logomorph@...>

Sent: Monday, October 16, 2000 4:55 PM
Subject: Re: To make a long story short (To late) Part 2


> Squizzy::
>
> She nodded,"yes the possabilities are endless. But bu creating
> something that isn't part of the natural order of a planet, one could
> disturb the environment and the natural balance of things it events
> got out of hand.  But if your looking for a warrior, yes, we could
> conceivably create the ultimate warrior."  She looked at the
> paperwork.  "Just out of curiousity, I can separate the DNA strands,
> but what exactly is it that your looking for?"
>
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Lady Hawk came close to smileing, she'd done well in yhe initial
> experiment,
> > unfortunately this Squishy or whatever her name was was to smart
> for her own

> trouble.
> >

> for the

> given

> combine the
> > DNA of nocturnal animals for whatever purpose we needed. think of
> the
> > possabilities, the size and agility of a bat, the sight of a hawk,
> the
> > strength of a panther" She shuddered to think about what someone
> like
> > Megatron would do with this technology. "We could repopulate
> planets, create
> > settlements, explore regions undreamed of."
